questions.question: Choose the correct demonstrative adjective: ___ libro (this book - near me)
questions.explanation: 'Este' is used for masculine singular nouns that are close to the speaker.

questions.question: Choose the correct demonstrative adjective: ___ casa (that house - near you)
questions.explanation: 'Esa' is used for feminine singular nouns that are close to the listener.

questions.question: Choose the correct demonstrative adjective: ___ montañas (those mountains - far away)
questions.explanation: 'Aquellas' is used for feminine plural nouns that are far from both speaker and listener.

questions.question: Complete: ___ coches son muy caros (these cars)
questions.explanation: 'Estos' is used for masculine plural nouns close to the speaker.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ problema es difícil (this problem)
questions.explanation: 'Problema' is masculine despite ending in -a, so we use 'este'.

questions.question: Complete: No me gusta ___ música (that music - you're listening to)
questions.explanation: 'Esa' refers to something near the listener but not the speaker.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ días fueron increíbles (those days - long ago)
questions.explanation: 'Aquellos' is used for masculine plural nouns distant in time or space.

questions.question: Complete: ___ mano me duele (this hand)
questions.explanation: 'Mano' is feminine despite ending in -o, so we use 'esta'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ tiempos eran mejores (those times - in the past)
questions.explanation: 'Aquellos' is used for masculine plural nouns referring to distant past.

questions.question: Complete: ___ flores huelen bien (these flowers)
questions.explanation: 'Estas' is used for feminine plural nouns close to the speaker.

questions.question: Select the correct demonstrative: ___ año ha sido difícil (this year)
questions.explanation: 'Este' is used for masculine singular nouns close to the speaker.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ época del año me encanta (this time of year)
questions.explanation: 'Época' is feminine, so we use 'esta' for something close to the speaker.

questions.question: Complete: ___ chicos de allí son mis amigos (those boys over there)
questions.explanation: 'Aquellos' is used for masculine plural nouns far from both speaker and listener.

questions.question: Choose the correct demonstrative: ___ ideas que tienes son buenas (those ideas you have)
questions.explanation: 'Esas' refers to feminine plural nouns close to the listener.

questions.question: Complete: ___ foto de la pared es antigua (that photo on the wall - far away)
questions.explanation: 'Aquella' is used for feminine singular nouns distant from both speaker and listener.

questions.question: Choose the correct indefinite adjective: ___ personas vinieron (some people)
questions.explanation: 'Algunas' is used with feminine plural nouns to mean 'some'.

questions.question: Complete: No tengo ___ dinero (any money)
questions.explanation: 'Ningún' is used before masculine singular nouns to mean 'no/not any'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ día iré a visitarte (some day)
questions.explanation: 'Algún' is the shortened form of 'alguno' used before masculine singular nouns.

questions.question: Complete: ___ estudiante puede hacer esto (any student)
questions.explanation: 'Cualquier' is used before singular nouns to mean 'any' (whichever).

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ libros están en la mesa (several books)
questions.explanation: 'Varios' is used with masculine plural nouns to mean 'several'.

questions.question: Complete: No hay ___ solución fácil (any easy solution)
questions.explanation: 'Ninguna' is used with feminine singular nouns to mean 'no/not any'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ personas llegaron tarde (few people)
questions.explanation: 'Pocas' is used with feminine plural nouns to mean 'few'.

questions.question: Complete: ___ cosa es posible (anything is possible)
questions.explanation: 'Cualquier' before a singular noun means 'any' in the sense of 'anything'.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ chicas vinieron a la fiesta (many girls)
questions.explanation: 'Muchas' is used with feminine plural nouns to mean 'many'.

questions.question: Complete: ___ problema tiene solución (every problem)
questions.explanation: 'Todo' is used with masculine singular nouns to mean 'every/all'.

questions.question: Select the correct indefinite adjective: ___ momento puede llegar (at any moment)
questions.explanation: 'Cualquier' is used before singular nouns to mean 'any' (at any time).

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ semanas han pasado (several weeks)
questions.explanation: 'Varias' is used with feminine plural nouns to mean 'several'.

questions.question: Complete: No conozco a ___ persona aquí (any person)
questions.explanation: 'Ninguna' is used with feminine singular nouns in negative sentences.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: ___ niño puede aprender esto (every child)
questions.explanation: 'Todo' is used with masculine singular nouns to mean 'every'.

questions.question: Complete: ___ amigos míos viven aquí (few of my friends)
questions.explanation: 'Pocos' is used with masculine plural nouns to mean 'few'.
